utterance.content: Ugh.

utterance.speaker: LANIE

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Well, yes. But no. utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yet tells us nothing about why our victim was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or does it? Our victim was tortured because the killer, like the king, wanted something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, our victim’s sister is meeting me in the precinct. Maybe she can shed some light on what that thing was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I pulled a warrant for Lars’s new safe deposit box, see if there’s a clue as to what our killer was after.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, this is Oprah’s assistant. Um … I’ll take this. You guys … head out without me. I’ll … be heading … to the precinct in just a little while. Guys, these are comedy gold. Seriously. Hello?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not funny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hang on, I can’t hear you.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.content: Are you getting any reception? Thank you. Hello? Yes. Well actually, it’s not about one of my books. It’s about my mother’s. No, I only wish I was joking.

utterance.content: Are you a cop?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geez!

utterance.content: I’m actually with the cops. I can send you the manuscript?

utterance.content: I know who the killer is.

utterance.content: Can you – can you – hold – hold on one moment.

utterance.content: It was Lars’s ex-boyfriend, Mark. Last night around nine Mark was banging on Lars’s door. Said Lars owed him money and that he better pay up or else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hang – hang on. You – can I call you right back? Hello? Hello? Shoot. All right, where were –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. Where’d she go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ms. Cross, your brother appeared to come into a great deal of money upon his return to the country. But we checked his financials and there’s no record of where it came from. Do you have any idea?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did he have any enemies? At home or abroad?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Even his ex-boyfriend Mark? According to Castle, a neighbor overheard Lars’s ex yelling outside of his apartment last night. Did your brother owe him money?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lars never paid him back, did he?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Mark, you used to date Lars. Well, according to these reports he called the cops on you over a dozen times in the past year.

utterance.speaker: MARK

utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: What can I do? I am a Pisces. But I am over Lars. And I moved on.

utterance.content: Not according to a witness who saw you threatening him last night.

utterance.content: Oh, yes. I threatened him. A lot. All right? I gave him twenty grand to get his degree and what thanks do I get? He dumps me and leaves the country. And now he’s back two months later rolling around in a Porsche. So … yeah. I went a little mental.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure. If by going a little mental you mean torturing and killing your ex.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: What? Lars is – is dead? Oh my – You think I did it?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: No. Lars was the love of my life. I could never just – look, Lars was alive when I left him. I swear to you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What time was that?

utterance.speaker: MARK

utterance.content: All right, let’s just, uh, suppose that you are telling the truth. What happened at Lars’s?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: He let me in, apologized for everything, and said he just needed a day to get the cash to pay me back. Wait, he was telling the truth?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The truth about what?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: He was acting all paranoid when he came back from Turkey and his partner thought he had double crossed him -

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hold on, hold on. What partner?

utterance.speaker: MARK

utterance.content: Well, I bet that pissed you off, huh?

utterance.speaker: MARK

utterance.content: We’re going to need that laptop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT

utterance.content: So what do you think Lars was smuggling?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he was in Turkey, which is the heroin pipeline from Afghanistan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. No. Wasn’t drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because Lars was beheaded by a scimitar. No, the storyteller inside me craves an explanation far more –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Farfetched?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pirate’s booty? Cold fusion? Alien cadavers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Those are all ridiculous theories. Did you say alien cadavers, though? Because I saw a documentary once –

utterance.content: Hey Castle, um, what was the name of that woman you interviewed? Lars’s neighbor?

utterance.content: Oh, I didn’t get her name.

utterance.content: I think my unis forgot to put her statement in this file. I swear, most of my time is spent checking people’s paperwork.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT

utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: RYAN

utterance.content: Oh please, no.

utterance.content: Come on! The money, the Porsche? Lars wished for them and his wishes were granted –

utterance.content: And here we go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - by a genie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lars found Aladdin’s lamp!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perfect! Thank you, Diane. Guys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at this. These books from Lars’s apartment on 1001 Arabian Nights. They all have handwritten notes in them.

utterance.content: This one has maps drawn in it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This one has his theories on where King Solomon is buried.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These books are his research that he used in conjunction with his skills as a sonar engineer, to unearth King Solomon’s tomb.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re with you on that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And to find the lamp with the magical genie in it.

utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.content: What’ve you got there?

utterance.content: The woman who wrote this book, Dr. Marion Baker, she’s a professor of Middle Eastern literature at Hudson University. We should go talk to her. Knowing more about the lamp will help us know why Lars was killed for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You just want to find out more about genies and wishes.

utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. Go ahead. Meet with Dr. Baker. Maybe she can talk some sense into you.

utterance.content: The schmuck I beat out for tenure.

utterance.content: Exactly. But the genie would be forced to wander the Earth until a new master rubs the lamp.

utterance.content: Tell me more, Dr. Baker.

utterance.speaker: MARION
utterance.content: Oh, sure. For the low, low price of $19.95. Buy my book.

utterance.speaker: MARION
utterance.content: You don’t give your stories away for free, Mr. Castle, and neither do I. So uh – – if you’ll excuse me I have a class to teach. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s just pretend that all this is real. You do realize that if Lars was the genie’s master it didn’t work out so well for him in the end.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you saying?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Be careful what you wish for. It might just come true. And in this case it might just get you killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I could really use a genie right now. I would wish that my kid was already born and sleeping through the night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, fatherhood has made you so damn boring. If I had a wish? I’d use it to become the top MMA fighter in the world. And take home a different hot chick every single night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, now that I think about it, I would wish that I could be a Broadway star. Play Jean Valjean in front of sold out crowds, win a bunch of Tonys.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’d wish to wear tights and sing show tunes for a living?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’d wish to wear Speedos and grapple sweaty men for a living.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And hook up with a different hot chick every single night, don’t forget that part.

utterance.content: You know what I wish? That my detectives would actually get some work done for living. While the two of you were on fantasy island I found a lead. Mike Harlin. utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s got to be Lars’s partner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I pinged his cell phone. It’s disconnected.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s making a run for it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And if he tortured the location of the antiquities out of Lars –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then there’s a good chance that he’s going to grab them and try to disappear for good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You.

utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You broke into my office?

utterance.content: No. The redhead let me in. So I could wait inside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You went through my desk.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: To look for a pen to write you a note. Wow, you are a very distrusting person.

utterance.content: Yes, I get that way when I’m lied to. I don’t know who you are but you sure as hell aren’t Lars’s neighbor. I’m calling the police.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: If you do I’m out that door. And you’ll never know how powerful of an ally I can be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, you’ve got one minute to convince me. Go.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: My name is Lindsay Dillon. I’m a journalist researching a story about looted antiquities. A source in Turkey hinted that Lars might have discovered King Solomon’s tomb. So I decided to keep tabs on him. That’s when I overheard the fight he had with his ex-boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why not tell the police? Why lie?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Because when you’ve got a dead body, a story about stolen relics turns from a back page snoozer to a front page lead – – just like that. And though I wanted to be helpful to your murder investigation –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you made an official statement every reporter would hear about your story and you’d lose your exclusive.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: See? I knew you’d get it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t explain why you broke into my office – – unless you have another lead.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: We’re both writers. Let’s help each other out. Only you’ve got to keep me as your anonymous source. Deal?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Deal. What’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Lars was working with a guy named Mike Harlin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. We know about him already but he’s missing. Unless you know where he’s been hiding.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: No. But I do know that Harlin used an alias while in Turkey. Al Aiden.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is great. I’m going to call this in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Al Aiden. Aladdin. Yeah, that’s cute. Beckett! Hey, I have a lead for you. It’s the –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a second. Stop that woman.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What woman?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The – the blonde woman. The woman who just –

utterance.content: How did she get past you?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! Away from the window! Now!

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Okay, okay!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Get on your knees right now!

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Chill, man!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Interlace your fingers behind your head.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: All right. I knew she’d lead you to me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: The genie, man. She’s out to get me.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Genies are evil. And their wishes bring about nothing but misery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah hah. I see what’s happening here. The uh, wandering Ronin genie is angry with Harlin for killing her master. That’s why she prevented him from finding the lamp.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Castle, the man is either delusional or he’s laying the groundwork for some BS insanity plea. What’s your excuse?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s talk about Lars and how you chopped his head off with a sword.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. I didn’t kill him. Okay? I was at my mom’s birthday party when he got murdered. Man, check it out! I’m sure whoever took Lars’s head off is coming for mine next.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really? Why is that?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: I know too much. Me and Lars, we met on the job in Turkey. Okay? And then one day, after our search for oil pockets, Lars came to me. He was all excited.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because he found the location of King Solomon’s tomb and you used your skills as an excavator to help him dig it up.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: No. No, it wasn’t that easy. We needed money to do it safely. Okay? So Lars, he found some guy. He offered us two hundred and fifty Ks, each, in cash, to do the dig.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: The catch was if we found something, well, Lars had to ship it to the guy who was here in New York.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, so who is this financier?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Look, the money was too good so I didn’t ask any questions. I – I wish I did, though. Because opening that tomb was the worst thing that could happen to us. I mean, the moment we took that lamp? That genie unleashed its vengeance, man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You can’t honestly be trying to tell us that you saw a genie.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: No. But genies can choose to appear or not to appear to anyone they want.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s true. Professor Baker told me that. And she’s a doctor, so …

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Guys. I didn’t believe in genies, either. Okay? Until my life fell apart. I found my girlfriend in bed with my roommate. And then I stayed with my mom and my mom accidentally threw out the duffle bag with my two hundred and fifty Gs. You know? And when I think that things, they – they can’t get any worse? I found out that Lars got his head lopped off and now that genie, that crazy, evil genie is after me, man. I know it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay Harlin, I’m going to have to get you off the crazy train that you’re riding on right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. We know that the shipment got screwed up and you suspected that Lars double crossed you.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: What? No. No, Lars did not double cross me. He got double crossed by the shipper. Okay, well, really the smuggler. You can’t just walk past customs with priceless relics and expect no one to notice, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Lars hired a guy back in Turkey to ship the items back. What was his name?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: I don’t know. I do know. Hold on! I do – I do know that he lied to the shipper. Okay? He told them it was just mining equipment. The only thing was that someone from his crew jimmied the crate and found the artifacts.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let me guess, the shipper started seeing dollar signs?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Yeah. And then he demanded four hundred grand, in cash, just to release the shipment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That explains the cash that we found in Lars’s safe deposit box.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right, but how the hell did Lars get his hands on four hundred thousand bucks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … don’t – don’t say that he wished for it. He probably got the money from the financier. Wait, wait. But the one thing that doesn’t make sense is if Lars already had the extortion money then why did the shipper kill him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … don’t! Do not say that it was to gain control of the genie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wasn’t gonna. Okay, I was. But there is another possibility. Maybe the shipper kept the treasure for himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then why torture Lars? I mean, what information could he possibly want if he already had the artifacts?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey guys, any leads on who the financier is?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, whoever paid for Lars and Harlin’s tomb raiding made sure to cover their tracks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Harlin’s alibi checked out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which means that this mystery shipper is our prime suspect.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If he was extorting Lars he’d have plenty of motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, check in with customs. Let’s get a list of all the ships that have come in from Turkey in the last week. If we can track down those antiquities that should lead us to the killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I’ve been doing some digging into that mystery blonde.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … you mean the reporter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She is no more a reporter than she was Lars’s neighbor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? She lied to you again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is the real Lindsay Dillon, a 65 year old black woman living in Tallahassee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ugh. So what’s the blonde’s angle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wish I knew. She lies out of one side of her mouth, helps with the investigation out of the other. It just doesn’t make any sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, for all we know she could be working with the killer, trying to steer us in the wrong direction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Twice! She just vanished on me. Vanished on me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Appearing and disappearing at will. Being both deceptive and helpful. They mystery blonde is Lars’s Ronin genie, wandering the Earth waiting for someone to find her lamp. She’s chosen to appear to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s it. I’m cutting you off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. She’s giving me clues, Beckett. She wants me to find the lamp. I think she wants me to be her new master.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you know what I think? You need to call me the next time you see her so I can question her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve gotta come up with a wish list. Oh my God, I have so many. How am I going to whittle it down to three?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s funny, I just have one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That my man would stop talking about being some skeezy blonde’s master and would start talking about taking his wife to bed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … well, I don’t need a genie – – to grant that wish.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo hey, Captain. So we cross checked customs records with the date that Harlin said Lars shipped the antiquities.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One ship left port that day in Istanbul. And the only cargo that it dropped off in New York was a shipment to this man. Yuruk Sezen. He runs a rug import business with a storefront in SoHo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So obviously he’s our shipper.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re headed there now. Hopefully he still has the antiquities.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Including the magic lamp.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … guys? Guys? If you find that lamp and Castle’s not there I’m never going to hear the end of it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll have him meet us there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Great. Oh, hey, hey! Can you make sure that he gets dibs on the first rub, please?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmmhm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Thanks. I owe you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ugh. I can’t believe I said that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you in here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m clear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like Yuruk’s skipped town.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why’re you playing with the carpets?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m checking if they’re magic. Think about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys? This carpet’s bleeding.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Déjà vu.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check out these bruises. Just like Lars.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Duct tape on his chest, wrist, and ankles. Someone must have tied him up, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So apart from the fully detached head, the MO is identical to Lars: tortured then killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, clearly Yuruk’s not our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the true killer must have tortured Lars to get to Yuruk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then tortured Yuruk to get to those stolen antiquities.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This body is still warm. The killer was just here. Castle, go call for backup.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait for them out front.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. No, right now they’re securing the back. All right, we’ll be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The genie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah hah! I knew it was you!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You – you are not who I thought you were. I’m so sorry. Have a lovely day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah … my back.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I’m going to need that back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. Let me just dust it off for you.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ah ah ah. Hands.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Travis, hurry it up. We’ve got company. Who the hell are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nobody.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: So you’re nobody doing nothing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pleased to meet you. I would love to chat, but uh, you are obviously busy with whatever clearly legal endeavor you’re engaged in.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: You a cop?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a cop.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa … whoa! What – what if I was a cop?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Either way I’m going to kill you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You shoot me, I drop this, and it breaks into a million pieces.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: It’s okay. I’ve got a dozen more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But do they have a genie?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What are you, five years old? I’m sorry, pal. I’ve gotta do what I’ve gotta do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I really wish you wouldn’t!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are a genie.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The lamp! But your lamp! It’s yours!

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Leave it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Couldn’t you have just flown us out of there on a carpet?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can’t make carpets fly?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Can you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not a genie.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Neither am I.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s something a genie would say, because they’re liars and tricksters.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: By that logic any liar could be a genie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I’ve caught you now and you’re not going anywhere. The cops are right over there and you’re going to tell us everything you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We put a net over the neighborhood. The truck and the treasure were gone. And because you didn’t get a license plate we have little chance of finding them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It all happened so fast.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, right. And yet, you did have time to – – creep over to the lamp, examine it, get held at gunpoint, rub the lamp, make a wish upon the lamp, and have a genie appear in a puff of smoke and knock the woman thug over the head with a two by four.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You forgot the part where it was dark and super dusty.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, you’re just lucky that Lanie was able to pull DNA off Yuruk’s body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she manage to get a match?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. But she was able to determine that the killer was a female.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Most likely the woman holding me at gunpoint.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or your magical blonde genie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The one only Castle’s seen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So neither of you believe me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, bro. I do believe you. Actually, I was able to ID the genie based on your description.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good work!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Laugh it up, you guys. I still have two wishes left. I’m not above using them for evil.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah! Alexis. Good. Great. Tell these guys I am not crazy for believing in a genie. And before you answer, remember I spent six months making an extra lunch for your imaginary friend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Guys, I was seven. But you’re not crazy. The mystery blonde is real.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But she’s not a genie. Her name is Genevieve Sutton. She has an office on 2nd Avenue. She’s listed as a security consultant.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A fixer, by the sounds of it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And how did you get this info, Alexis?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, after Dad left I dusted his desk for prints. Got a little help from Hayley, who ran them through the DMV database and voila.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she’s not a genie.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Genevieve is short for genie. I mean, seriously, if she can grant wishes, a driver’s license, that would be a piece of cake.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh huh. But why would a genie want to do that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, seriously. Who cares?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Make believe time with Castle is over.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re going to bring in Genevieve and find out the real story.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Someone need some ice cream?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You may have everyone else fooled, but not me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, let me in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am your master. I command you to tell me the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you a genie or not?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Can you let her in? Because you’re seriously weirding me out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to take that as a maybe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I apologize, but his behavior is the least of your worries. You are accused of two homicides and connected to the theft and trafficking of millions of dollars in antiquities. So your best bet is to start talking.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Look, I didn’t kill anyone. And I was trying to keep the relics from falling into the wrong hands. And I would have, too, if I hadn’t had to save your reality-challenged husband.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I prefer fantasy-augmented.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, what do you mean by wrong hands?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Lars was hired to excavate the antiquities in order to protect them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hired by who?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: An anonymous benefactor. Let’s call him Mr. X. With the Syrian conflict threatening to spill over into Turkey, Mr. X became concerned that Solomon’s tomb would be destroyed, or worse, looted, and the relics sold to fund terrorism.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you know all of this, how?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Mr. X retained my services in order to ensure Lars recovered the artifacts from Yuruk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But instead Lars ended up dead.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Unfortunately. The night that Lars was murdered I was pulled away on a false lead. When I got back the cops were everywhere, so I targeted Mr. Castle as a way to learn what the police knew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t suppose you got the license plate of that truck as you were saving me?

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: No. But I did before I saved you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: State police has found the truck.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tapped into a live feed from a rest stop outside of Rye.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, babe. Sorry, it’s not really a good time right now. What? Uh, yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah. I will be right there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um … hey guys? Jenny’s having the baby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s awesome, man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, great! Go! Go!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Call me, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: DISPATCH
utterance.content: Captain, what’s your status?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Captain Beckett. Is there anything in that truck?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Genevieve said that there would be twelve.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I bet I know which crate is missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s the lamp, Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’ve got one chance to help yourself here. Now, we know you didn’t kill Yuruk. Traffic cams put you and the truck on the other side of the city when he was murdered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That makes you and Travis little more than the hired help.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I’d do myself a favor and start talking. Beginning with who you delivered the lamp to.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I might be hired help … but I ain’t no rat. I want a lawyer. I know my rights.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: DNA confirms that our killer’s a woman, but someone with resources and connections. Not this flunky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A killer who knew Lars. A woman who would risk losing the entire shipment for the ultimate prize: the lamp. And I know just the person to lead us to it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dr. Baker, thank you again for coming to see us.

utterance.speaker: MARION
utterance.content: How could I resist when you told me you found the genie from Aladdin’s lamp?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That was a little bit of a white lie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. See, we were looking back over Lars’s school records from Columbia. It turns out he actually audited a class of yours at Hudson University a few years back.

utterance.speaker: MARION
utterance.content: I have hundreds of students every year. I’m afraid I can’t remember all of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s strange. Your TA remembers that you and Lars would meet regularly during your office hours.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: In fact, he said that you guys met the morning that Lars returned from Turkey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now Lars, I’m sure, shared the discovery of the lamp with you knowing that you of all people would appreciate its value, but what he wasn’t counting on was your professional jealousy.

utterance.speaker: MARION
utterance.content: Why would I be jealous?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve been searching for King Solomon’s tomb for over fifteen years. We talked to the dean of your department. He told us about your obsession. How it ruined your marriage and nearly destroyed you.

utterance.speaker: MARION
utterance.content: That is not true.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because you never found that tomb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now that must have been a bitter pill to swallow. Knowing that Lars used all of your hard earned research to find something that you never could. And now he was going to get all the fame and fortune that you never would.

utterance.speaker: MARION
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, you really do have an overactive imagination. You could no more prove that story you just spun than you could prove that genies come out of lamps and grant three wishes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, that’s not true. Uniforms searched your home. They found the lamp.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess you’re as good at hiding treasure as you are at finding it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dr. Baker, you’re under arrest for the murder of Lars Cross and Yuruk Sezen.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You better watch out, Castle. I may have to steal your blonde.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I still have two wishes left. All the rubbing in the world is not going to do you any good. Can I get a "that’s what she said"?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … who’s that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Prince Khalid Hasheim of the Jordanian royal family. He’s here to bail out Genevieve.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Methinks we found our mysterious Mr. X.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Prince Hasheim, I’m Captain Beckett. This is Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or perhaps we should call you Mr. X.

utterance.speaker: GENEVIEVE
utterance.content: Mr. X is my employer. He paid me to protect the contents of King Solomon’s tomb.

utterance.speaker: PRINCE KHALID HASHEIM
utterance.content: Right. Well, I don’t know this gentleman, but anyone who helps protect the history of my region is to be applauded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. So what’s going to happen to the antiquities and the lamp now?

utterance.speaker: HASHEIM
utterance.content: Well, I’m no expert, but given the way they entered the country and their connection to a murder trial, they’ll be tied up in legal battles for years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. I’m sorry to hear that. I am sure that Mr. X will be very disappointed considering that he worked so hard to procure them.

utterance.speaker: HASHEIM
utterance.content: I don’t know about that, Captain. If one wished to keep priceless history safe from looters and terrorists there is no better place for them to wait out the conflict than in the basement of the Smithsonian.

utterance.speaker: HASHEIM
utterance.content: It was a pleasure to meet you both. Come along, Gennie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here we go again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That – she was – that -

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I just got off the phone with Ryan. There’s been some complications with Jenny’s labor.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Everything was normal, uh … until Jenny started hyperventilating. She lost consciousness. The doctors think it might be a, uh, amniotic fluid embolism.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But they’re – they’re trying to stabilize her now so that they can deliver the baby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re here, bro. Whatever you need.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks. Thanks. I should get back in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s settle in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So, um … obviously I don’t believe in genies or wishes, but just in case I was wondering if you could use one of your wishes for Jenny and the baby.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I already did. Both of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Uh … doctors, they stabilized Jenny and – – she delivered a healthy baby boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What’s his name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His name is Nicholas Javier Ryan.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Aww.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tell me you spelled it right on the birth certificate.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Aww, I want one too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if you see that genie again you mind telling her I said thank you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I think I’m done with genies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Why the change of heart?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, because of you, of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, really? So after eight years some of my common sense has finally rubbed off on you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, no, no. Nothing like that. Um … I have no need for genies, simply because I already have everything I could ever wish for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right back at you, handsome.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, wait. Um … so you wouldn’t even wish for a working lightsaber?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Transporter? Like the ones in Star Trek? You would never have to fly again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I like flying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh. Time machine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only to go back and fall in love with you all over again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. That was a good answer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Make way, Daddy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’s Jenny?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, she’s exhausted.
